docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 (UPI) -- Airline pilots asked the Federal Aviation Agency yesterday to ban the carrying of prisoners on commercial airliners unless they are handcuffed and accompanied by an armed escort....
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10 (UPI) -- Airline pilots asked the Federal Aviation Agency yesterday to ban the carrying of prisoners on commercial airliners unless they are handcuffed and accompanied by an armed escort.
docs.abstract: Pilots ask FAA to bar prisoners from commercial carriers unless they are handcuffed and have armed escort

headline.main: PILOTS ASK GUARD ON PRISON FLIGHTS; Ruling Asked to Ban Travel by Unescorted Convicts

docs.snippet: The Obama administration is not considering a ban on travelers from countries most affected by the deadly Ebola virus outbreak, the White House said on Monday....

docs.snippet: After officials said they would let seven Americans leave Egypt during a prosecution of nonprofit groups, there were signs of a political backlash....
docs.lead_paragraph: After officials said they would let seven Americans leave Egypt during a prosecution of nonprofit groups, there were signs of a political backlash.
docs.abstract: Egyptian officials say that they will lift a travel ban barring seven Americans from leaving the country during the politically charged prosecution of four American-financed nonprofit groups, apparently resolving a crisis that threatened to break the 30-year alliance with Washington; in order for the defendants to leave the country, they will be required to pay large sums as bail, as high as $300,000 each, and pledge to return for their trial.

headline.main: Egypt Says It Will Lift Travel Ban, Allowing American Defendants to Leave
headline.print_headline: Egypt Says It Will Lift Travel Ban, Allowing American Defendants to Leave

byline.contributor: David D. Kirkpatrick reported from Cairo, and Steven Lee Myers from Washington. Mayy El Sheikh contributed reporting from Cairo.

docs.abstract: Zycie Warszawy (pub), apparently to explain Poland's refusal to let Wyszynski attend, charges him with 'blind pol rage,' disloyalty and meddling in foreign affairs

docs.snippet: LONDON, April 1 -- The government has been exhorting the people to give up their Easter holiday for the sake of the war effort. There is little hope, however, that the pleas will be widely heeded, for the British people will give up almost everyth...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, April 1 -- The government has been exhorting the people to give up their Easter holiday for the sake of the war effort. There is little hope, however, that the pleas will be widely heeded, for the British people will give up almost everything, except a long, free week-end.
docs.abstract: War effort: govt asks pub to give up Holy Wk holidays

headline.main: BRITONS IGNORE BAN ON EASTER HOLIDAY; Heavy Travel Foreseen Despite Pleas to Remain at Home
